Material used.Description: Yeast two-hybrid screening was performed using a human fetal brain cDNA library to identify TTRAP as a novel DJ-1 interactor.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant DJ-1 (M26I and L166P) exhibited enhanced binding to TTRAP compared to wild-type DJ-1, disrupting TTRAP-mediated cytoprotection.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple independent screenings were conducted to validate TTRAP-DJ-1 interactions.

Technical replicates.Description: Each interaction was confirmed using independent yeast transformations.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for TTRAP interaction.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector or unrelated bait constructs served as negative controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Binding affinity within physiological range (custom threshold based on literature).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Binding affinity >2-fold higher than wild-type (custom threshold based on literature).

Material used.Description: TTRAP-mediated cytoprotection against apoptosis was assessed in SH-SY5Y cells expressing wild-type or mutant DJ-1.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant DJ-1 (M26I and L166P) failed to protect cells from apoptosis, leading to JNK/p38-MAPK activation.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in triplicate across independent cell cultures.

Technical replicates.Description: Each condition was tested in quadruplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1-expressing cells served as positive controls for cytoprotection.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as negative controls.
